name: European Federation of Public Service Unions
membership: EPSU is a member of the European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC) and is the regional organisation of the Public Services International (PSI)
goal:
EPSU brings together 7.2 million public service workers from 264 trade unions. 68.5% of our members are women. EPSU organizes in health and social services, and local and national administration, and energy, water and waste sectors. EPSU is a member of the ETUC and the European regional organisation of the PSI (Public Services International).

EPSU seeks to strengthen universal access to quality public services and good employment conditions as key elements for the European social model.
interests: Borders and Security, Climate Action, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives: EPSU is active in a number of EU policy areas, i.e. sectoral policy (energy, health), internal market (public procurement), social policy (employment, social dialogue), and public services (SGI).
